meanings.definition: The quality of being current or up-to-date.
meanings.sent1: Her presentation lacked currentness, as she used outdated statistics.
meanings.sent2: I always strive to maintain the currentness of my knowledge in the fast-changing world.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show poked fun at the lack of currentness in the characters' fashion choices.
meanings.sent4: The currentness of the news updates kept the audience engaged throughout the broadcast.
meanings.sent5: The currentness of the information shared in the seminar was crucial for making informed decisions.

meanings.definition: The state of being in progress or happening now.
meanings.sent1: The currentness of the construction project is evident from the workers on site.
meanings.sent2: We need to assess the currentness of the situation before making any decisions.
meanings.sent3: The currentness of the party preparations caused excitement among the guests.
meanings.sent4: The currentness of the storm's path kept everyone on high alert.
meanings.sent5: The currentness of the music trends reflects the ever-evolving tastes of the audience.
